title: Install cuda 9.0  - cudatoolkit 9.2
body_html:
Issue description

installing Pytorch - cuda 9.0 with conda

"conda install pytorch torchvision -c pytorch"

triggers the installation of cudatoolkit-9.2

Conda displays the following:

"The following packages will be downloaded:

package                    |            build
---------------------------|-----------------
pytorch-0.4.1              |py36_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.1.2_1       463.8 MB  pytorch
torchvision-0.2.1          |           py36_1         123 KB  pytorch
cudatoolkit-9.2            |                0       351.0 MB
ninja-1.8.2                |   py36h6bb024c_1         1.3 MB"

which, obviously, cannot work.
Workaround: manually trigger the installation of cudatoolkit-9.0 (conda install cudatoolkit==9.0)

Proposed solution: fix the conda package

I work under Ubuntu 18.04 and nVidia drivers 390.
Upgrading to higher version of nVidia drivers is an issue on my system due to secure boot.

## Issue description

installing Pytorch - **cuda 9.0** with conda

"_conda install pytorch torchvision -c pytorch_"

triggers the installation of **cudatoolkit-9.2**

Conda displays the following:

"The following packages will be downloaded:

    package                    |            build
    ---------------------------|-----------------
    pytorch-0.4.1              |py36_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.1.2_1       463.8 MB  pytorch
    torchvision-0.2.1          |           py36_1         123 KB  pytorch
    cudatoolkit-9.2            |                0       351.0 MB
    ninja-1.8.2                |   py36h6bb024c_1         1.3 MB"

which, obviously, cannot work.
Workaround: manually trigger the installation of cudatoolkit-9.0 (conda install cudatoolkit==9.0)

Proposed solution: fix the conda package

I work under Ubuntu 18.04 and nVidia drivers 390.
Upgrading to higher version of nVidia drivers is an issue on my system due to secure boot.
